summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Alaska Airlines, dated January 23, 2020, commanding the airline to produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell for two time periods (1994-1998 and 2019 onward). The document includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for a custodian of records.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena requests all records from Alaska Airlines for Ghislaine Maxwell (also known as Ghislaine Borgerson) for specified time periods as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for Alaska Airlines
events.description: The subpoena commands Alaska Airlines to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in New York to testify and produce records.

locations: Alaska Airlines, 19300 International Blvd, Seattle, WA 98168
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Alaska Airlines on January 23, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion/enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The subpoena specifically requests all records related to Ghislaine Maxwell for two distinct time periods: January 1, 1994, through December 31, 1998, and July 1, 2019, through the date of service.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Alaska Airlines voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

The document indicates an active federal grand jury investigation was ongoing in the Southern District of New York as of January 2020, focusing on violations potentially related to sex trafficking and conspiracy.
